What is Verus, and how is it related to Komodo?

Verus is a blockchain forked from Komodo, which is considered the world's most secure privacy blockchain. As a result, Verus inherits many of Komodo's security features, such as dPoW (a form of Proof of Work that "backs up" the blockchain to the most secure blockchain in the world) and zk-SNARK privacy (a form of privacy built into its blockchain, similar to ZCash).

What is Verus?
Verus is a blockchain forked from Komodo, the world’s most secure privacy blockchain. The Verus coin, VRSC, is a CPU Mineable coin which utilizes VerusHash, the fastest cryptographic hash algorithm in the world. It can be mined on x64 CPUs which has significantly leveled the playing field with GPUs.
Because Verus is a fork of Komodo, it comes with the same first in class security features, such as dPoW…a form of Proof of Work that essentially “backs up” the blockchain to the most secure blockchain in the world, presently Bitcoin. However, chains forked from Komodo can notarize to Komodo’s blockchain. This allows them double the protection against attacks while giving them the effect of instant security, as if they were as mature as the blockchains they are backing up to (notarizing to).
Also a part of the package with Komodo comes zk-SNARK privacy. Komodo was a fork from ZCash and has the same level of privacy built into its blockchain. You can learn more about zk-SNARK and zCash here.
Unlike Komodo, Verus implements a combination of PoW and PoS (Proof of Work and Proof of Stake, respectively). This is a 50/50 split in which half the blocks are mined by mining and the other half by staking. Mining and Staking is done using a modified version
./raw_text_input_medium/How to Setup a Verus (VRSC) Staking Server with Email Alerts Using Ubuntu and a $5 DigitalOcean…-2019-06-26 20:35:13
What makes Verus unique compared to other cryptocurrencies?

Verus is unique in that it combines both Proof of Work (PoW) and Proof of Stake (PoS) consensus mechanisms, with a 50/50 split between the two. This means that half of the blocks are mined using PoW, and the other half are staked using PoS. Additionally, Verus uses the fastest cryptographic hash algorithm in the world, VerusHash, which allows it to be mined on x64 CPUs, leveling the playing field with GPUs.

What are some benefits of using Verus?

Verus offers several benefits, including double protection against attacks due to its ability to notarize to Komodo's blockchain, instant security, and zk-SNARK privacy. Additionally, its combination of PoW and PoS consensus mechanisms provides a unique approach to securing the network.
